events.event_name: Bank of England interest rate decision
events.description: The Bank of England kept interest rates unchanged at 3.75%, but the vote split surprised investors, with four of nine MPC members favoring an immediate 25 basis point cut to 3.5%.

facts.fact_text: UK 10-year gilt yields fell to 4.55% in afternoon trade.

evidences.evidence_text: UK 10-year gilt yields fell to 4.55% in afternoon trade, giving back earlier gains, after the Bank of England kept interest rates unchanged at 3.75% but signaled a more dovish stance than markets had expected.

facts.fact_text: The Bank of England kept interest rates unchanged at 3.75%.

evidences.evidence_text: after the Bank of England kept interest rates unchanged at 3.75%

facts.fact_text: Four of nine MPC members favored an immediate 25 basis point cut to 3.5%.

evidences.evidence_text: the vote split surprised investors, with four of nine MPC members favoring an immediate 25 basis point cut to 3.5%

facts.fact_text: Earlier in the session, gilt yields had reached an over three-month high of 4.612%.

evidences.evidence_text: Earlier in the session, gilt yields had reached an over three-month high of 4.612%

claims.claim_text: The Bank of England signaled a more dovish stance than markets had expected.

evidences.evidence_text: after the Bank of England kept interest rates unchanged at 3.75% but signaled a more dovish stance than markets had expected.

claims.claim_text: Expectations that CPI inflation will return toward the 2% target from April.

evidences.evidence_text: citing expectations that CPI inflation will return toward the 2% target from April.

claims.claim_text: Risks from persistent inflation have eased.
claims.author: Bank of England

evidences.evidence_text: The Bank highlighted that risks from persistent inflation have eased

claims.claim_text: Weaker demand and a softening labor market have become more pronounced.
claims.author: Bank of England

evidences.evidence_text: while weaker demand and a softening labor market have become more pronounced.

evidence.evidence_text: after the Bank of England kept interest rates unchanged at 3.75% but signaled a more dovish stance than markets had expected.
citing expectations that CPI inflation will return toward the 2% target from April.
while weaker demand and a softening labor market have become more pronounced.
while weaker demand and a softening labor market have become more pronounced.

Earlier in the session, gilt yields had reached an over three-month high of 4.612%, driven by rising political uncertainty after Prime Minister Keir Starmer appointed Peter Mandelson as UK ambassador to the US, a move attracting scrutiny over Mandelson’s past links to Jeffrey Epstein.
